data.title: triple j Unearthed
data.meta_description: Young Byron Bay musician/composer/dj Madhu Oliver combines with Oz music legends Brendan Hanley, Mal McGhee, Julie Oliver. Matt Hanley and top regiona
data.text: Literally born in a recording studio and the son of professional musical parents, 25 year old Madhu Oliver began to combine keyboard and computer skills, often working with his close friend Glenn O'Meara, employing beats, samples and lots of original feels and riffs. Before long he had a hard drive full of funky, infectious grooves, which were combinations the Afro and Jamaican influences he had grown up with, but sitting in a contemporary hip hop/funk niche ... a result of his dj work and association with the nightclub world ... which gave him a solid understanding of what the punters like to groove to when they go out to party. His father Brendan "Mook" Hanley ("Marijuana Australiana"), longtime Oz musician, songwriter and lyricist has been a friend of legendary soul singer Mal McGhee, who shot to prominence in the sixties in a series of amazing bands like the Purple Hearts, the Wild Cherries, and of course Python Lee Jackson ... who must surely be able to claim the title of ...
